author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A troubadour from Occitania who doth compose songs of love and chivalry, enchanting all who hear her voice.

newsMedieval:
Upon the slumber of our feather'd kin,
David Obuchowski's quill doth my heart win,
In 'How Birds Sleep,' adorned with Pedry's art,
A wonder to behold, enchanting each part.

Blank space

Now, 'Big Tree' dost rise, Selznick's tale so grand,
Through verdant leaves our knowledge doth expand,
A tale of growth, and life, stretched to the skies,
In its branches, wisdom's beauty lies.

Blank space

From Voisard's skilled hand, 'Arborama' sprung,
A tribute to the trees in verses sung,
Their majesty and grace, their history,
In each fine line, their essence we shall see.

feedItems.title: A Closer Look
feedItems.description: Selections from ‘How Birds Sleep’ by David Obuchowski, illustrated by Sarah Pedry

feedItems.title: A Closer Look
feedItems.description: Selections from ‘Big Tree’ by Brian Selznick

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous and satirical, might contain references to wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In this Yorkish trial, I dost see,
Guo Wengui, jailed, denied to flee,
On lies and dirtied coins, he stands,
Cast out from distant Chinese lands.

How Old, thou asketh, is the Whale?
Dear Lily Murray pens the tale,
With Jesse Hodgson's drawings fine,
A closer look at nature's sign.

The Earth Transformed, a tale of blight,
'Tis said that doom may see respite,
In cycles passed, both man and bower,
Have shaped each other, hour by hour.

feedItems.title: Guo Wengui Denied Bail While Awaiting Trial in New York
feedItems.description: The exiled Chinese businessman has been in jail on fraud and money-laundering charges since March.

feedItems.title: A Closer Look
feedItems.description: Selections from ‘How Old is a Whale?’ by Lily Murray, illustrated by Jesse Hodgson

feedItems.title: 'The Earth Transformed' Review: Doom May Be Delayed
feedItems.description: For eons, human civilizations have shaped—and been shaped by—the natural world.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess.

newsMedieval:
In Ritchie's fabled tale, the Covenant doth unfold,
As stalwart Gyllenhaal storms Afghan lands, so bold,
Facing Taliban and strife, with interpreter, be told,
A saga of grim conflict, in Ritchie's vision, hath been scrolled.

With seedlings of the mind, our children's wights shall learn,
In tale of 'Big Tree,' 'Arborama,' knowledge doth they yearn,
Through 'Wings, Waves & Webs,' young minds shall duly turn,
'How Old Is a Whale?' and bards of sleeping birds discern.

For Gerald Ford, called 'Ordinary Man,' we sing,
The bard dost praise the 38th president of thee, so underrating,
Through storm and strife, he led, a listener daring,
For him, we raise our voice, in verses thus abating.

feedItems.title: 'Guy Ritchie's The Covenant' Review: Action in Afghanistan
feedItems.description: The British director’s unusually straightforward new film stars Jake Gyllenhaal as an American sergeant navigating Taliban-riddled territory with a local interpreter.

feedItems.title: Children's Books: Seedlings of the Imagination
feedItems.description: Reviews of ‘Big Tree,’ ‘Arborama,’ ‘Wings, Waves & Webs,’ ‘ How Old Is a Whale?’ and ‘How Birds Sleep.’

feedItems.title: 'An Ordinary Man' Review: Underestimating Gerald Ford
feedItems.description: Listening more than talking, the 38th president guided America through a tumultuous era. He receives too little credit for it.
